Introduction.chapter_title: Mzee Fundi and His Unusual Tenant
Introduction.content:
Everyone in Kijijini knew Mzee Fundi – the best carpenter in the whole of Tanga region. He was 82 years old, wore the same blue overall for 20 years, and shared his workshop with one very special tenant: a huge black cobra that lived under the workbench.

Mzee Fundi called the snake ‘Bwana Nyoka’. He greeted him every morning with a respectful “Shikamoo, Bwana Nyoka” and the snake would nod back.

One day Mzee Fundi noticed something strange…

Chapter 1.chapter_title: The Day the Snake Started Saying “Password”
Chapter 1.content:
Mzee Fundi arrived at the workshop and said his usual “Shikamoo!”

Instead of nodding, the cobra lifted its head and hissed:

“Pass… word… ni… gani…?”

![Shocked old man hearing snake talk](https://picsum.photos/seed/shocked-mzee-snake/800/600)

Mzee Fundi dropped his hammer. “Wewe unazungumza?! Since when?!”

The snake flicked its tongue and replied slowly: “Since… nimechoka… kuwa… offline…”

Chapter 2.chapter_title: Installing a Router in a Cobra’s Hole
Chapter 2.content:
Mzee Fundi didn’t hesitate. He went straight to the Vodacom shop.

“Nataka WiFi bundle ya unlimited!”

Shop lady: “How many devices, babu?”

Mzee Fundi: “Moja tu… lakini ni nyoka.”

![Shop attendant confused by old man buying WiFi for snake](https://picsum.photos/seed/confused-vodacom-lady/800/600)

Half an hour later he came back with a router, 50-metre LAN cable, and a power bank. He drilled a tiny hole next to Bwana Nyoka’s home and installed the router inside the wall.

Password: **Shikamoo123**

Chapter 3.content:
That evening the workshop lights were off, but the router was blinking blue.

Mzee Fundi peeped through the window and saw this:

- The cobra wearing tiny sunglasses
- Watching **Money Heist** on a cracked tablet
- Eating popcorn (yes, real popcorn)

![Cobra wearing sunglasses watching Netflix](https://picsum.photos/seed/cobra-netflix-sunglasses/800/600)

Every time Tokyo appeared on screen, the snake would hiss “Ayyyy Tokyo mi amor!”

Chapter 4.chapter_title: Bwana Nyoka Becomes an Instagram Influencer
Chapter 4.content:
Within a week the snake had:

- 87k followers @bwana_nyoka_official
- Blue tick
- Brand deals with Cobra Energy Drink

His most viral reel: slow-motion hood flare set to “Waka Waka” by Shakira.

![Snake taking selfie with iPhone](https://picsum.photos/seed/snake-influencer-selfie/800/600)

Caption: “Living my best life. Thanks to my human @mzee_fundi”

Chapter 5.chapter_title: The Day Vodacom Sent a Bill to Mr Sssssslither
Chapter 5.content:
End of the month, a Vodacom envelope arrived:

“To: Mr Sssssslither
Address: Under the workbench, Kijijini Workshop”

Bill: 187,000 TShs – 4.7 TB data used!

Breakdown:
- Netflix 4K → 2.1 TB
- TikTok → 1.8 TB
- Snake porn → 0.8 TB (don’t ask)

![Vodacom bill addressed to snake](https://picsum.photos/seed/vodacom-bill-snake/800/600)

Mzee Fundi paid without complaining. “Education is expensive,” he said.

Conclusion.chapter_title: Happily Ever After… With Good Internet
Conclusion.content:
Today Mzee Fundi and Bwana Nyoka are best friends.

The workshop now has fibre optic, a second router just in case.

Neighbours no longer fear the snake – they fear missing his 8 PM Instagram Live.

![Mzee Fundi and snake taking selfie together](https://picsum.photos/seed/mzee-and-cobra-selfie/800/600)

Moral of the story:
Never say “Hakuna kitu” when an old man tells you his snake needs WiFi.

The end.
